thread.title: Buffalo seeking bids to bring ‘Pay by Cell’ to parking meter program
thread.title_full: Buffalo seeking bids to bring ‘Pay by Cell’ to parking meter program

title: Buffalo seeking bids to bring ‘Pay by Cell’ to parking meter program
text:
Buffalo seeking bids to bring ‘Pay by Cell’ to parking meter program on October 16, 2015 - 7:28 PM Tweet ADVERTISEMENT 
Buffalo moved a step closer to modernizing its parking meter program with Friday’s announcement that the city has requested that bidders submit proposals to bring “Pay by Cell” to Buffalo. 
City officials said they hope the system can be in place as early as February. 
“This is as convenient as it gets,” said Mayor Byron W. Brown. “City residents and/or visitors to Buffalo can stop looking for cash or credit or debit cards if they choose this option.” 
The city would install “Pay by Cell” throughout the city, but all parking spots would also have traditional meters or “Pay and Display” boxes for those who don’t have smartphones, city officials said. 
The city is also upgrading its 125 “Pay and Display” boxes to a 3G network, which will enable the machines to operate more quickly, said Kevin Helfer, the city’s Parking Commissioner.
